greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, then a(n) is the smallest number such that a(a(n)) = 2n+1.
comment: Original name was "Similar to A079905, but without the 'monotonically increasing sequence' condition."
link: Charlie Neder, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..499
formula: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 3, a(4k) = 4k + 2, all other terms follow from the criterion defining the sequence. - _Charlie Neder_, Dec 21 2018
results.author: _Eric Angelini_, Aug 02 2010
